response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age and Gender", "medium", "Being a young adult male is associated with higher recidivism risk."),
    ("Race", "medium", "Identifying as Black may subject the individual to systemic biases that can affect recidivism risk assessments."),
    ("Criminal History", "high", "Multiple arrests and a conviction history strongly elevate the risk of rearrest."),
    ("Marital Status and Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married are associated with reduced social support, increasing risk."),
    ("Educational Attainment", "low", "Enrolling in a 4-year college is a protective factor, indicating future prospects and improved social integration."),
    ("Employment History", "medium", "Holding two jobs suggests some stability but may also reflect economic pressures; overall, it gives moderate risk mitigation."),
    ("Substance Use", "high", "Recent drug use including marijuana and cocaine is a high risk factor for recidivism."),
    ("Mental Health", "high", "Experiencing depressive symptoms indicates potential mental health issues that can increase recidivism risk if unaddressed."),
    ("Family Background", "low", "Growing up with both biological parents in an urban area may have provided some stability, reducing risk."),
    ("Religious Belief", "low", "Believing that God influences his life can serve as a protective factor, promoting resilience and social support.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult male is associated with higher recidivism risk.
Identifying as Black may subject the individual to systemic biases that can affect recidivism risk assessments.
Multiple arrests and a conviction history strongly elevate the risk of rearrest.
Living alone and never having been married are associated with reduced social support, increasing risk.
Enrolling in a 4-year college is a protective factor, indicating future prospects and improved social integration.
Holding two jobs suggests some stability but may also reflect economic pressures; overall, it gives moderate risk mitigation.
Recent drug use including marijuana and cocaine is a high risk factor for recidivism.
Experiencing depressive symptoms indicates potential mental health issues that can increase recidivism risk if unaddressed.
Growing up with both biological parents in an urban area may have provided some stability, reducing risk.
Believing that God influences his life can serve as a protective factor, promoting resilience and social support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 3 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 195 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
